data.title: Calzones Awesome!
data.text: Ate here for the first time. I had the Mediterranean calzone. It was the best calzone I have ever had! Lovely historical building.

data.title: Okay Pizza
data.text: Love downtown Lee's Summit and was looking forward to trying this place. The wait staff is nice. I had a Caesar salad which was good. The pizza was just okay. The crust didn't have any flavor and that is usually my favorite part.

data.title: You won't be disappointed!!
data.text: Our favorite pizza place! We always stop in when we are in town! Highly recommend this place! From their yummy appetizers (our favorites are the pretzels with cheese and the cheese sticks) to the pizza, you can't go wrong! Our kids love it as well!!

data.title: Lees Summit's most unique pizzeria.
data.text: Always get a friendly greet coming in.  Good beer selection.  Salads are very good.  The pizza's have a different flavor and style than any other in LS.  It is a little pricey for pizza, but they do have a good lunch special.  I often take my office out for lunch here.

data.title: Best pizza pie I've had in many years!!
data.text: Our fist visit here. In 40 years I've traveled 30 states and 20 countries, this pizza pie is in the top 3 I've ever eaten! Located in the heart of Lee's Summit, they have ample parking within walking distance. If you park a few blocks away you'll enjoy the sights while you walk. If you play Pokemon Go, you'll walk will be slower - lot's of stops and Pokemon.  All their pizzas pies are gluten free. They sell by the slice, but ask the waitress about the selections on the slices. I had the Mediterranean 9" pie and it was delicious; enough  just for me. My wife had the Asian salad with mango dressing and that was delicious too; enough for two people! We took Papa a 9"  pepperoni and sausage pie and he was extremely satisfied. My wife had the peach sangria and enjoyed it very much. The restaurant has four TVs that can be seen from all seats. If you play Pokemon Go, seat near Main Street, you can hit at least two poke-stops and perhaps one gym. If you are fortunate, Annie will be your hostess. She is amazing, yes, hostess, because she treated use as if we were in her house - not more than five minutes went by without seeing her smile and her ensuring our drinks were fresh, our food was to our satisfaction, or if we needed anything else. If you are in the pizza mood and are in the KC Metro are, it is worth the drive. We will return.

data.title: Best Pizza and Salads in LS!
data.text: Our favorite go to spot for Pizza or Salad in the area! My boys love the pretzels for appetizer and our favorite pizzas  are the Buffalo Chicken, Stockyard, and Pepperoni. I've had several of their salads and it is a tough pick. They are all served with a generous portion of chicken along with many fresh and great toppings! Great atmosphere to bring your family or to drop in beer and slice of pizza.

data.title: My new favorite pizza
data.text: Main slice pizza is my new favorite pizza.  Their signature pizza is perfect with thin hand tossed crust. They have a nice selection of wine. The atmosphere is comfortable and friendly.

data.title: Love this pizza place!
data.text: If you love pizza, go to Main Slice! Any pie is divine. The handmade pretzels are a must. From going with a group to grabbing a slice with a side salad - this place is THE place for pizza in Lee's Summit. They even have the Abe Froman, an all sausage pie... throwback to Ferris Bueller's Day Off. Fun!

data.title: Average
data.text: For the price point, I thought it would be better. Not bad, but not the best I have ever had. I think we will stick to Waldo's when we want to go out for pizza.

data.title: Good pizza and Salads
data.text: Main Slice Pizza is a nice place to stop in for a slice of pizza or a whole one. Our family likes the varied menu and casual atmosphere.

data.title: Best pizza in Lee's Summit
data.text: We love the pizza and the atmosphere of this locally owned pizza joint. Great prices, great food in beautifully renovated downtown Lee's Summit.

data.title: Pizza and Beer joint
data.text:
Pizza kinda similar to "Spin" pizza crust. Choose your topics or go for one of their creations. Hot dog slices on pizza, really!
A few big screens over bar, long and narrow place. More appetizers would have been a good idea. The Depot Dip is a cheesy pot of goodness with flat bread.

data.title: Good calzones
data.text: Went for dinner on a Sunday evening. Ordered a meatball calzone and build you own pizza. Calzone was cooked perfectly. Meatballs had a nice flavor. Marina was good, could have used more seasoning. Smaller place, one side has booths against a brick wall. Bar along other side with big screen tvs. Nice beer selection, did not have land shark on tap like their menu notates. Also had depot dip appetizer which was spinach dip with extra cheese. Served with flatbread. Two is us shared an appetizer. One person had a calzone, one had personal pizza. Both had leftovers. Each had a bottle of beer, total was @ $41. Service decent, had to go and ask for check and to go boxes. Otherwise good service. Would recommend, very good food.

data.title: Best Pizza in Lees Summit
data.text: Main Slice has the best pizza in Lees Summit hands down. Very fresh cheese and meat; great New York style pizza. The cheese bread is also very good.

data.title: So Good.
data.text: I love the look of the inside with the brick showing. The pizza is amazing. I go for the cal-zones as they are so good and filled with whatever you choose!

data.title: Great atmosphere & food
data.text: We were a group of 6 who ate there last night.  From teens to 50+, we all found the food excellent and the service (Thank you, Megan!), excellent. We enjoyed their specialty pies; the guys liked the KC Stockyard & my favorite was the Farmers Market.  I had eaten there once before last fall for their lunch special.  That was excellent as well.  Side salad, a slice of pizza & a drink for under $8.  That's 2 for 2!

data.title: Homemade goodness
data.text: My family and I visited on a weeknight and seated ourselves right away. Very good service and nice downtown location. I had a decent margarita and there were plenty of other adult drink options. Split the Main Street pizza with my parents and it was delicious but lacking a bit in toppings. My husband had the Abe Froman calzone and said it was just okay. Kids liked the cheese pizza but not the s'mores dessert pizza. They also sell pizza by the slice. We liked the New York style crust, not too thick or too thin. We will be back to try some of their other pizzas and salads.

data.title: Awesome pizza!! Great building
data.text: I love thin, east coast pizza. Looking for a couple drinks and a fresh pizza I chose Main Slice from my quick research online being from Boston and it was much better than I thought it would be. We went in a little later in the evening on a Monday so it was quiet. Kortni the bartender was super friendly and happy to serve us and greeted us right away. A rare treat these days. The building was a cool brick historic building on Main St with lots of character. Love the vintage neon. The pizza by the slice were big and looked great. We ordered a 14" pie though and it was thin but not too thin. It had a beautiful crisp charred crust only achieved with a great fresh dough and a scorching hot oven. We had mushrooms, fresh baby spinach and large pepperoni. Spinach and mushrooms had a fantastic flavor and the pepperoni was excellent!! Reminded me of some great pizza from home and happy to find such a fresh well made pizza here. Great job guys!! Highly recommend!!

data.title: The pizzas and salads are great!
data.text: The historical building is worth the visit and the pizzas and salads are tasty.  The beer selection needs to be expanded, but it is still a fun place to dine.

data.title: We will be back!
data.text:
.
Love supporting local restaurants,  very good, I had the Calzone meatball, hubby had the KC Stockard pizza. Also, per reviews had to try the Pretzel bites. Service was excellent.  Came for a early dinner on a Saturday night, no waiting.
